system.description: You can spend 1 AP to make 1 Attack Check.

You can spend 1 AP to make an Attack Check Contested by the target's Athletics, Acrobatics, or Trickery Check (targets choice).

The target has ADV if theyre holding the object with 2 hands. You have DisADV if the target is larger than you. You cant Disarm a creature thats 2 Sizes larger than you.

Success: The targeted object falls into an unoccupied space of your choice within 1 Space of the creature.

rAhzI1qOxxsXLX17.name: Size Check

system.description:
Using a free hand, you can spend 1 AP to attempt to Grapple another creature within 1 Space.

Make an Athletics Check contested by the opposing creatures Martial Check.

You or the target may have ADV or DisADV on your Check based on each others size (see @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.ae17b973b3872de1]{Moving & Grappling Creatures}).

  • Success: The creature is Grappled by you.

Moving the Target

You can move the target to any Space adjacent to you by spending your own Movement to do so. Alternatively, when you move, you can move the target with you, but youre considered Slowed (Every 1 Space you move costs an extra 1 Space of movement).

Multiple Grapplers: If you attempt to move or throw a target (see Throw Creature Maneuver) thats also Grappled by 1 or more other creatures, you must make a Contested Athletics Check against all the other Grapplers.

  • Success: You move or throw the target as normal and break the Grapple of all other creatures who were also Grappling that target.

Ending a Grapple

Escape Grapple: The target can spend 1 AP to attempt to free itself from the Grapple. When it does, it makes an Acrobatics or Athletics Check contested by your Athletics Check. Success: The Grapple immediately ends.

Incapacitated Grappler: If you become Incapacitated, the Grapple immediately ends.

Forced Movement: If an effect attempts to forcibly move the target beyond your reach, you make the Check or Save instead of the target. If the effect targets both you and the target, you make 1 Check or Save for both of you.

  • Success: The targets of the effect are not moved.

  • Failure: The Grapple immediately ends, and the targets of the effect are moved.

Falling: If the target begins falling (and you dont), the Grapple ends if you cant carry the targets weight. If you can carry its weight, you hold it suspended in the air.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to push a creature within 1 Space of you. Make an Athletics Check contested by the targets Martial Check.

Success: You push the creature 1 Space away from you or to its left or right.

Success (each 5): Push up to 1 additional Space.

Knock Prone: After the result, you can choose to reduce the total distance the target is pushed by 1 Space to knock them Prone instead.

DC Tip: If you shove a creature into a target, follow the rules for hitting the target in the Collision section.

If you move at least 2 Spaces in a straight line, you can spend 1 AP to attempt to Tackle a creature thats your size or smaller.

Make an Athletics Check contested by the target's Martial Check.

Success: You Grapple the target and you both move 1 Space in the same direction you were moving then immediately fall Prone.

Success (each 5): +1 Space moved.

You can spend 1 AP to throw an object or a creature you have Grappled.

Object

The target is thrown up to a number of Spaces away as shown in the Throwing Table. For the purposes of throwing, your minimum Might is 1. The total distance thrown is halved if thrown vertically.

Throw at a Target: When you throw an object at a target its considered a Ranged Martial Attack with an Improvised Weapon against the targets PD.

  • Hit: The target takes 1 damage of a type determined by the GM.

  • Miss: The thrown object continues traveling up to your maximum throwing distance.

DC Tip: When you throw Weapons (including an Improvised Weapon) that lack the Toss or Thrown Properties as part of an Attack, you make the Attack with DisADV.

Creature

Make an Athletics Check against the targets Might Save.

  • Check Success: The target is thrown up to a number of Spaces away as shown in the Throwing Table (ending the Grapple).

For the purposes of throwing, your minimum Might is 1. The total distance thrown is halved if thrown vertically upward.

Throw at a Target: When you throw the creature at a target, you compare your Athletics Check against the targets PD.

  • Hit: The thrown creature and the target share the Collision damage (each take half).

  • Miss: The thrown creature continues traveling to your maximum throwing distance.

Throwing Table

Size

Spaces Thrown

2+ Sizes smaller

2 x Might

1 Size smaller

Might

Same Size

1/2 Might

Larger

Impossible

Example: A Medium sized creature with a Might of 0 (minimum Might of 1) could throw a Tiny object up to 2 Spaces, a Small object 1 Space, and Medium object 1 Space (rounded up from 0.5). Conversely, if that creature had a Might of 6, they could throw a Tiny object 12 Spaces, a Small object 6 Spaces, and a Medium object 3 Spaces.

System Info: In the DC20 system, throwing is not a basic action and has its own section in the rules. For automation purposes, I added it to the actions.
You can spend 1 AP to impose DisADV on Opportunity Attacks made against you until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Disengage
effects.description: You impose DisADV on Opportunity Attacks made against you until the start of your next turn.

system.description: You can spend 2 AP to become immune to Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Full Disengage
effects.description: You are immune to Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

system.description: You can spend 1 AP to impose DisADV on the next Attack or Grapple made against you before the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Dodge
effects.description: You impose DisADV on the next Attack or Grapple made against you before the start of your next turn.

system.description: You can spend 2 AP to impose DisADV on all Attacks or Grapples made against you until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Full Dodge
effects.description: You impose DisADV on all Attacks or Grapples made against you until the start of your next turn.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to Hide from 1 or more creatures that cant see you (Unseen).

Make a Stealth Check against the opposing creature(s) Passive Awareness.

Success: You become Hidden from creatures whose Passive Awareness you beat (making you Unseen and Unheard by them).

You remain Hidden until you make a noise louder than a whisper, make an Attack, cast a Spell with a Verbal Component, or a creature takes the Search Action and successfully locates you.

See @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.a0d67820b3677829]{Hidden Creatures} (@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.6396da38cde5e264]{Unseen}, @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.8c1b9e075707a2ce]{Unheard}, @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.38850187f9364dd3]{Hidden}) for more on hiding.

When you take the Hide Action and beat an enemys Passive Awareness, you only become Hidden from that creature because it cant see or hear you (youre both Unseen and Unheard). However, if your Stealth Check beats one enemys Awareness Score but not anothers, then youre Hidden from the first enemy, but youre not Hidden from the second enemy.

effects.name: Hidden
effects.description: You become Hidden from creatures whose Passive Awareness you beat.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to move up to your Speed in Spaces (default of 5).

You choose where to move, and can break up your movement by moving before and after taking a different Action.

You cant end your turn in a Space occupied by another creature.

A creature with 4 AP can take the Move Action to move 1 Space, take the Attack Action, move 1 Space again (2 total Spaces), take the Attack Action again, and then move 2 Spaces again (4 total Spaces).

TXdeNOrH8C8yuOHh.name: preItemRoll

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to grant another creature a d8 Help Die that lasts until the start of your next turn. Upon granting the Help Die, you must declare which creature youre Helping and the type of Check youll be aiding them with while meeting the following conditions:

  • Attack: You declare 1 target for the Attack. You must be within 1 Space of the Attacker or the target of the Attack. While the Help Die lasts, it can be added to an Attack made against the target.

  • Skill or Trade Check: You declare a type of Skill or Trade Check. You describe how youre Helping them and must do so with a Skill or Trade that you have at least 1 Mastery Level in. You can use the same Skill or Trade or a different one.

The Help Die can only be used to aid the type of Check declared and disappears once it is used.

Multiple Help Penalty: Once you take the Help Action, each time you take the Help Action again before the end of your turn, your Help Die decays by 1 step, to a minimum of a d4 (d8 | d6 | d4). These Help Dice only decay when using the Help Action. Help Die granted by other sources (such as the Sword Maneuver) decay independently of any Help Dice grant through the Help Action.

You can spend 1 AP to perform 1 of the following object interactions:

  • Drink a Potion or administer a Potion to another creature.

  • Attempt to lock or unlock a Lock.

  • Make a Trickery Check to activate or disable a trap or other mechanism.

  • Transfer an item to or from another creature (only 1 of the two creatures spends 1 AP).
You can spend 1 or more AP to cast a Spell that you know. If the Spell has a Mana Point requirement, you must spend that much MP to cast the Spell.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to recall or discern some information about a creature that you can see or hear. Make a DC 10KnowledgeCheck.

Success: You learn a piece of lore about the creature.

Success (each 5): You learn 1 creature statistic (PD, AD, Attacks, Abilities, Resistances, Vulnerabilities, Immunities, etc.).

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to beguile a Beast that can see or hear you. Make an Animal Check contested by the targets Charisma Save.

Success: The animal is Taunted by you for 1 minute (Repeated Save) or until you target it with a harmful Attack, Spell, or other effect.

Success (5): Its also Impaired.

Success (10): Its also Charmed.

effects.description: You have DisADV on Attack Checks against creatures other than the one that Taunted you. If a creature is successfully Taunted while already Taunted by another creature, the original Taunt is removed.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to discern the course of actions a creature might take on its next turn.

Make an Insight Check contested by the targets Trickery or Influence Check (its choice).

Success: You learn the targets emotional state and whether it plans to make an Attack, cast a Spell, or flee combat during its next turn.

Success (5): You know who the creature is likely to target with a harmful ability.

Success (10): You know which ability the creature plans to use.

If the target is a PC, its player tells you what the creature plans to do. If the target is an NPC, the GM tells you what the creature plans to do.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to hide an object on yourself or in nearby foliage, debris, or decor to render it Hidden.

Make a contested Trickery Check against the Passive Awareness of creatures that can see you.

Success: The object is Hidden from any creature whose Passive Awareness you beat.

You can spend 1 AP to make a Trickery Check Contested by the targets Insight Check.

Success: The next Attack against the target before the start of your next turn has ADV and deals +1 damage.

effects.name: Feint
effects.description: The next Attack against you has ADV and deals +1 damage.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to intimidate a creature that can see or hear you within 10 Spaces.

Make an Intimidation Check contested by the targets Charisma Save.

Success: The target is Intimidated by you until the end of your next turn.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to uncover a concealed object on a creature, a secret compartment, or the intended function of a mechanism within 1 Space of you.

  • Concealed Objects: You can attempt to uncover any objects concealed on a creature.

    Make an Investigation Check contested by the targets Trickery Check.

    Success: You know the location of any concealed object on the creature.

  • Secret Compartments: You can attempt to uncover any secret compartments. Make an Investigation Check against the discovery DC of any secret compartments.

    Success: You discover the location of any secret compartments whose discovery DC you beat.

  • Discern Mechanism: You can attempt to discern the functionality of a mechanism (the effect of a trap, how to open a secret door, or activate a device). Make an Investigation Check.

    Success: You learn how the mechanism works and the methods to activate and disable it (if any).

When you perform a Jump, you can spend 1 AP to increase your Jump Distance for the Jump.

Make a DC 10 Acrobatics Check.

  • Failure: Your Jump Distance increases by 1.

  • Success: Your Jump Distance increases by 2.

  • Success (each 5): +1 Jump Distance.

DC Tip: Remember, your Long Jump Distance equals your Jump Distance in Spaces, and your High Jump distance equals your Jump Distance in feet.

You can spend 1 AP to touch a creature and tend to its wounds.

Make a DC 10 Medicine Check.

Success: You stop its Bleeding or Stabilize it (your choice).

Success (each 5): The creature gains +1 Temp HP.

You can spend 1 AP to maneuver a mount youre riding to avoid danger.

Make a DC 10 Animal Check.

Success: The mounts PD increases by 2 until the start of your next turn.

Success (5): +2 PD.

Success (10): +4 PD.

effects.name: Mounted Defense
effects.description: The mounts PD increases by 2 until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Mounted Defense +2
effects.description: The mounts PD increases by 4 until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Mounted Defense +4
effects.description: The mounts PD increases by 6 until the start of your next turn.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to move through a Space occupied by a hostile creature thats within 1 size of you.

Make a contested Martial Check against the target.

Success: You can move through the creatures Space as if it were Difficult Terrain (Slowed while moving through the area).

Success (5): You can move through the creature's space without it counting as Difficult Terrain.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to locate 1 or more Hidden creatures and concealed objects within your Line of Sight.

  • Hidden Creatures: You attempt to locate any Hidden creatures in the area. Make an Awareness Check against the Stealth Check of any Hidden creatures.

    Success: You know the location of any Hidden creature whose Stealth Check you beat until the end of your turn. Knowing a creatures location does not grant you the ability to see it.

  • Hidden Objects: You attempt to locate any Hidden objects in the area. Make an Awareness Check against the DC to discover any concealed objects (such as traps, secret doors, or hidden items).

    Success: You discover the location of any Hidden object whose discovery DC you beat.

Without obstruction, a PCs line of sight could reach the horizon. You might ask your PC to make their Awareness Check with DisADV to detect a creature thats far away, such as beyond 10 Spaces.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to taunt a creature that can see or hear you within 10 Spaces.

Make an Influence Check contested by the targets Charisma Save.

Success: The target is Taunted by you for 1 Round.

Prerequisite: Martial Path

Trigger: A creature you can see within your Melee Range uses its movement to leave your Melee Range, draws a Weapon or Spell Focus, picks an item up off the ground, or takes the Object Action.

Reaction: You can spend 1 AP to make a Melee Martial Attack against the provoking creature.

DC Tip: You can spend additional AP to gain ADV or to perform Maneuvers with the Attack.

Prerequisite: SpellcastingPath

During a Spell Duel, the creature casting the Spell is referred to as the Caster and the opposing creature is referred to as the Challenger.

If multiple creatures attempt to initiate a Spell Duel, one of them must be chosen as the Challenger, while the others assist them through Combo Casting. Additional creatures can also choose to assist the Caster when a Spell Duel is initiated (see Combo Casting for more information).

Trigger: You see an MP Effect being cast, provided the Caster or a target is within 5 Spaces of you.

Reaction: You can spend an amount of AP and 1 or more MP (up to your Mana Spend Limit) to attempt to stop the Casters MP Effect. The amount of AP spent is equal to the base AP cost of the MP Effect you are trying to stop.

Contest

Make a Spell Check contested by the Spell Check or Spell Attack that the Caster makes to cast their MP Effect.

If the Casters MP Effect doesnt require a Check, they have to make a Spell Check as a Reaction as part of the Spell Duel.

For the purposes of the Spell Duel, the Caster and Challenger each gain a bonus to their Check equal to twice the MP spent they spent respectively.

Beta Note: Since enemies dont have MP costs for their MP Effects you can assume that their MP Effects cost an amount of MP equal to half their Level (rounded up).

Outcomes

Success: The Casters MP Effect fails and has no effect.

Failure: The Casters MP Effect succeeds and takes effect. The Check bonus gained from MP spent doesnt apply to the MP Effects Success and Failure Statements.

Tie: The Casters MP Effect fails, has no effect, and you each roll on the @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.roll-tables.RollTable.HxkcpDT6pEOIfYUk]{Wild Magic Surge Table}. The effect from the table lasts for 1 Round.

Resources Lost: Whatever the result, each creature still spends all AP, MP, or other resources as normal.

Example: A Caster makes an MP based Spell Attack and a Challenger attempts to stop it. The Casters Spell Attack cost 1 AP and 2 MP. The Challenger must spend 1 AP and at least 1 MP to attempt to stop the Spell Attack. The Caster makes an Attack Check (since its a Spell Attack) and the Challenger makes a Spell Check. The Caster gets a +4 bonus to their Attack Check (2 MP spent) and the Challenger gets a +2 bonus to their Spell Check (1 MP spent). Should the Caster win the Contest, their MP Effect takes effect but they dont include the +4 bonus from MP spent to determine if they score a Heavy Hit or higher.

Yalv653kxQPs5FZf.name: Trigger Spell Duel

system.description:
You must spend 1 AP at the start of each of your turns to Sustain an effect until the start of your next turn.

You can't Sustain an effect while Dazed. When you become Dazed, any effect youre Sustaining ends. You can choose to end the effect at anytime for free.

Outside of Combat: You can only Sustain 1 effect at a time outside of Combat. If you attempt to Sustain a second effect while already Sustaining a first, the first effect immediately ends.
You can spend 1 MP to add 2 AP worth of AP Enhancements to a Spell. You can do this multiple times per Spell.

vprOl4a2bVE14Qps.name: Spend MP on AP Enhancements
vprOl4a2bVE14Qps.description: You can spend 1 MP to add 2 AP worth of AP Enhancements to a Spell. You can do this multiple times per Spell.

system.description: You can spend SP in place of AP to add AP Enhancements to a Maneuver and to perform Weapon Style Enhancements.

UXHJqPd2gpsBARBu.name: Spend SP on AP Enhancements
UXHJqPd2gpsBARBu.description: Use this Enhancement if you want to spend 1 SP instead of 1 AP on Martial or Weapon Style Enhancement. You cannot use it on Maneuver Enhancements!

system.description:
All characters with Weapon Combat Training gain access to the following Martial Enhancements:

  • Damage: The Attack deals +1 damage against 1 target of the Attack.

  • Range: The Attacks Range increase by 1 Space if its a Melee Attack, or by 5 Spaces if its a Ranged Attack. This Enhancement can only be performed once per Attack.

  • Daze: A creature of your choice targeted by the Attack makes a Might Save against your Save DC. Save Failure: The target becomes Dazed until the end of their next turn.

DC Tip: Remember, a Dazed creature cant Sustain any effects at the start of their turn! While Martial characters cant stop a Spell from being cast like a Spellcaster can with a Spell Duel, a Martial Character can more easily disrupt a Sustained Spell by causing the Spellcaster to lose focus.

Example: You spend 2 AP and 1 SP on an Attack against an enemy creature. 1 AP to take the Attack Action (make 1 Attack Check), 1 AP to add the Martial Enhancement: Damage to deal +1 damage, and 1 SP to add the Martial Enhancement: Range to grant your Attack some extra range.

IMLTv3kcURrCFEMj.name: Damage
IMLTv3kcURrCFEMj.description: The Attack deals +1 damage against 1 target of the Attack.

HIwlrlBlxlCLv2Zz.name: Range
HIwlrlBlxlCLv2Zz.description: The Attacks Range increase by 1 Space if its a Melee Attack, or by 5 Spaces if its a Ranged Attack. This Enhancement can only be performed once per Attack.

xi77VBZRytVXGNTh.name: Daze
xi77VBZRytVXGNTh.description:
A creature of your choice targeted by the Attack makes a Might Save against your Save DC.

Save Failure: The target becomes Dazed until the end of their next turn.

system.description:
Bleed: The target makes a Repeated Physical Save.

Failure: The target begins Bleeding.

lz2CZLwzmFETS4m9.name: Axe Style
lz2CZLwzmFETS4m9.description:
Bleed: The target makes a Repeated Physical Save.

Failure: The target begins Bleeding.

system.description:
Slow: The target makes an Agility Save.

Failure: The target is Slowed until the end of its next turn.

vtFaUNGab7y927j7.name: Bow Style
vtFaUNGab7y927j7.description:
Slow: The target makes an Agility Save.

Failure: The target is Slowed until the end of its next turn.

system.description: Accuracy: You add a d4 to your Attack Check.

Tw9iHE1AB8p96WYq.name: Crossbow Style
Tw9iHE1AB8p96WYq.description: Accuracy: You add a d4 to your Attack Check.

system.description:
Fist Weapons are considered to be a free hand for the purposes of Grappling.

Grapple: The target makes a Physical Save.

Failure: The target becomes Grappled by you.

xOP94XwRdDjzzvpe.name: Fist Style
xOP94XwRdDjzzvpe.description:
Fist Weapons are considered to be a free hand for the purposes of Grappling.

Grapple: The target makes a Physical Save.

Failure: The target becomes Grappled by you.

system.description:
Knockback: The target makes a Might Save.

Failure: The target is pushed 1 Space away.

Each time you use this Enhancement, the target is pushed 1 additional Space.

Lz2TqPMK2UpXPajP.name: Hammer Style
Lz2TqPMK2UpXPajP.description:
Knockback: The target makes a Might Save.

Failure: The target is pushed 1 Space away.

Each time you use this Enhancement, the target is pushed 1 additional Space.

system.description:
Hinder: The target makes an Agility Save.

Failure: The target becomes Hindered until the end of their next turn.

7mqZiHZNvUiWeVoD.name: Pick Style
7mqZiHZNvUiWeVoD.description:
Hinder: The target makes an Agility Save.

Failure: The target becomes Hindered until the end of their next turn.

system.description:
Hinder: The target makes an Agility Save.

Failure: The target becomes Hindered until the end of their next turn.

2elbe7RKG5M7lEMD.name: Sling Style
2elbe7RKG5M7lEMD.description:
Hinder: The target makes an Agility Save.

Failure: The target becomes Hindered until the end of their next turn.

system.description:
Slow: The target makes an Agility Save.

Failure: The target is Slowed until the end of its next turn.

rnp8hiTLKpXzMt36.name: Spear Style
rnp8hiTLKpXzMt36.description:
Slow: The target makes an Agility Save.

Failure: The target is Slowed until the end of its next turn.

system.description:
Trip: The target makes a Physical Save.

Failure: The target falls Prone.

CO4fYXWcTBa3r5hr.name: Staff Style
CO4fYXWcTBa3r5hr.description:
Trip: The target makes a Physical Save.

Failure: The target falls Prone.

kjkcnbjc5plk6bsd.name: Sword Style
kjkcnbjc5plk6bsd.description: Accuracy: You add a d4 to your Attack Check.

system.description:
Pull: The target makes a Might Save.

Failure: The target is moved horizontally 1 Space toward you or to your left or right. Each time you use this Enhancement, the target is moved 1 additional Space.

OzJNH5Gud3WiskPi.name: Whip Style
OzJNH5Gud3WiskPi.description:
Pull: The target makes a Might Save.

Failure: The target is moved horizontally 1 Space toward you or to your left or right. Each time you use this Enhancement, the target is moved 1 additional Space.

system.description:
Draconic Origin

Choose a Draconic Origin from the list below. All futurechoices within this Ancestry must use the chosen DraconicOrigin. The type of damage associated with your DraconicOrigin is your Draconic damage.

  • Elemental Origin: Corrosion, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison.

  • Mystic Origin: Radiant, Psychic, Sonic, or Umbral.

Default Traits

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.3YH1b9nvHlw31AgA]{(1) Darkvision}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.eN1EKDqzMxxZd2A9]{(2) Draconic Breath Weapon}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.HWDwd2Ibf4wK7u3A]{(2) Draconic Resistance}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.7nOCHb3llandPzQJ]{(0) Reptilian Superiority}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.cbeNIfxgclOCjjN3]{(1) Draconic Affinity}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.Aq5ZxkvrdFy1mUY0]{(1) Draconic Protection}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.xHe6yaoXcD7C8OLr]{(1) Draconic Ward}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.xODnV7ejV7aEqW3b]{(1) Dying Breath}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.CTV2hAdhkjkJ9qVV]{(2) Glide Speed}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.B5m8I5dOZSgC3Fsn]{(-1) Guardians Bond}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.0UrvejAga4KKNGMr]{(1) Mana Increase}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.gh5h3EAT9FgKwf25]{(1) Thick-Skinned}

eN1EKDqzMxxZd2A9.name: Draconic Breath Weapon
eN1EKDqzMxxZd2A9.description:
You gain a Breath Weapon that you can use by spending 2 AP to exhale destructive power in an Area or Focused against a specific target.

You can use this ability once per Long Rest, and regain the ability to use it again when you roll for Initiative.

  • Area: Make a Spell Check against every targets AD within a 3 Space Cone or 6 Space Line.
    Hit: The target takes 2 Draconic damage.

  • Focused: Make a Spell Check against 1 targets PD within 6 Spaces.
    Hit: The target takes 4 Draconic damage.

Before you make your Spell Check, you can spend 1 or more SP, MP, or a combination of both to increase the damage.

When you do, the Area damage increases by 1 per SP spent and 2 per MP spent, and the Focused damage increases by 2 per SP spent and 4 per MP spent.

HWDwd2Ibf4wK7u3A.name: Draconic Resistance
HWDwd2Ibf4wK7u3A.description: You gain Resistance to your Draconic damage type.

7nOCHb3llandPzQJ.name: Reptilian Superiority
7nOCHb3llandPzQJ.description: You have ADV on Intimidation Checks against reptilian creatures of Medium Size and smaller (not including other Dragonborn).

e0Jwk688hdE7uC84.name: Concussive Breath
e0Jwk688hdE7uC84.description:
Requires: Draconic Breath Weapon

When you use your Draconic Breath Weapon, you can force all targets to make a Physical Save. 

Save Failure: The target is pushed 1 Space away +1 additional Space for every 5 it fails its Save by.

cbeNIfxgclOCjjN3.name: Draconic Affinity
cbeNIfxgclOCjjN3.description: When you take damage of the same type as your Draconic damage, your next Draconic Breath Weapon deals +1 bonus damage.

Aq5ZxkvrdFy1mUY0.name: Draconic Protection
Aq5ZxkvrdFy1mUY0.description: Once per Combat, when an ally within 20 Spaces is on Death's Door, you begin to surge with an ancient power. While they remain on Death's Door their PD and AD increases by 5 till Combat ends.

xHe6yaoXcD7C8OLr.name: Draconic Ward
xHe6yaoXcD7C8OLr.description:
Once per Combat, when you enter Death's Door, you gain 2 Temp HP.

Whenever youre Hit by a Melee Attack while you have this Temp HP, your Attacker takes 1 Draconic damage.

xODnV7ejV7aEqW3b.name: Dying Breath
xODnV7ejV7aEqW3b.description:
Once per Combat, when you enter Death's Door, you regain a use of your Draconic Breath Weapon and can immediately use it as a Reaction for free.

System TIp: Use that item to trigger that Breat Weapon.

CTV2hAdhkjkJ9qVV.name: Glide Speed
CTV2hAdhkjkJ9qVV.description:
You have a set of wings that you can use to horizontally glide and slow your descent.

Provided you aren't Incapacitated you gain the following benefits while in the air:

  • Controlled Falling: You suffer no damage from Controlled Falling.
  • Altitude Drop: If you end your turn mid air, you controlled fall 4 Spaces.
  • Glide Speed: You can use your movement to glide horizontally.

B5m8I5dOZSgC3Fsn.name: Guardians Bond
B5m8I5dOZSgC3Fsn.description: When an ally enters Death's Door within 20 Spaces of you you take an amount of True damage equal to your Prime Modifier.

p0DQXDC70PZb82yP.name: Second Breath
p0DQXDC70PZb82yP.description:
You can now use your Draconic Breath Weapon twice per Combat.

Additionally, whenever you use your Draconic Breath Weapon, you can spend 2 uses to increase its damage by 2 if it is an Area or by 4 if its Focused.

gh5h3EAT9FgKwf25.name: Thick-Skinned
gh5h3EAT9FgKwf25.description: While you aren't wearing Armor, you gain +1 AD.

system.description: You have a Darkvision of 10 Spaces.

effects.description: You have a Darkvision of 10 Spaces.

effects.name: Draconic Resistance
effects.description: You gain Resistance to your Draconic damage type.

system.description: You have ADV on IntimidationChecks against reptilian creatures of Medium Size and smaller(not including other Dragonborn).

Champions are weapon and armor specialists that push themselves to the limit in combat. They are able to master a wide variety of weapon types and learn their enemies as they fight them.

Source of Power: Champions train intensely to master all types of weapons and armor. They could be outfit in heavy armor and a shield, swing a greatsword with ease, or become a highly trained archer.

Starting Equipment

Arsenal: Choose 3 of any of the following items: Weapon or Shield.

Armor: 1 set of Armor.

Trade Tools: Choose 1 of any of the following items: Carpenters Tools, Cartographers Tools, Gaming Kit, or Masons Tools.

Adventuring Pack: Choose 1 of the following packs: (Adventuring Packs Coming Soon).

Champion Martial Path

Combat Training: Weapons, All Armor, All Shields

Maneuvers: The number of Maneuvers you know increases as shown in the Maneuvers Known column of the Champion Class Table.

Stamina Points: Your maximum number of Stamina Points increases as shown in the Stamina Points column of the Champion Class Table.

TALENT

blC9lZ8UnSZci4Kz.name: Champion Stamina
blC9lZ8UnSZci4Kz.description: Once per round, you can regain up to half your maximum SP when you perform a Maneuver.

o3A1c3BNoF3vnlwI.name: Fighting Spirit
o3A1c3BNoF3vnlwI.description:
You stand ready for Combat at any moment, granting you the following benefits:

  • Combat Readiness: At the start of your first turn in Combat, you gain one of the following benefits:

    • Brace: You gain the benefits of the Dodge Action and ADV on the next Save you make.

    • Advance: You gain the benefits of the Move Action and ADV on the next Physical Check you make.

  • Second Wind: Once per Combat when you start your turn Bloodied, you can regain 2 HP and 2 SP.

System Tip: Roll this item to trigger Combat Readiness.

lMCeeVziJxm0Ht1f.name: Master-at-Arms
lMCeeVziJxm0Ht1f.description:
Your training in warfare has granted you the following benefits:

  • Weapon Master: At the start of each of your turns, you can freely swap any Weapon youre currently wielding in each hand for any other Weapon without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

  • Maneuver Master: You learn 1 Maneuver of your choice. Once per Round when you perform a Maneuver, you can reduce its SP cost by 1.

Ye0XBnNhAcNaUmZ7.name: Know Your Enemy (Flavor Feature)
Ye0XBnNhAcNaUmZ7.description:
You can spend 1 minute observing or interacting with a creature out of Combat (or spend 1 AP in Combat) to learn information about its physical capabilities compared to your own

Choose one of the following stats of the creatureto assess:

  • Might

  • Agility

  • PD

  • AD

  • HP

Make a DC 10 Knowledge or Insight Check (your choice).

Success: You learn if the chosen stat is higher, lower, or the same as yours.

GcUiH6kTpiYE4uic.name: Cleave
GcUiH6kTpiYE4uic.description:
You swing wide to attack targets around you.

Range: 1 Space Arc (Self)

Make an Area Martial Attack against the AD of every target within range.

  • Hit: The target takes the damage of your Weapon or Unarmed Strike.

Reach Weapon: If you have a Reach Weapon, you can extend the Point of Origin 1 Space away from you. The Arc must still be facing away from you.

Maneuver Enhancements

Damage: (2 SP, Repeatable) The damage increases by 1.

Area: (2 SP, Repeatable) The Arc increases by 1 Space.

Careful Cleave: (1 SP, Repeatable) You can choose 1 target in the area to avoid with the Attack.

C9svqZ5bQeMbQxuF.name: Savage Strike
C9svqZ5bQeMbQxuF.description:
You cause a creature to bleed with the ferocity and precision of your attack.

Range: Weapon or Unarmed Strike

Make a Martial Attack against the PD of a target within range, and it makes a Repeated Physical Save against your Save DC.

  • Hit: The target takes the damage of your Weapon or Unarmed Strike.

  • Save Failure: The target becomes Impaired for 1 minute or begins Bleeding (your choice).

System Tip: To choose between conditions, simply use one of the enhancements. This maneuver takes this into account when determining the base cost.

Maneuver Enhancements

Improved Bleed: (1 SP, Repeatable) The target gains a stack of Bleeding.

Improved Impaired: (1 SP, Repeatable) The target gains a stack of Impaired.

Weakened: (2 SP) The target gains a stack of Weakened.

Q0Iu7pD3RrXPuAvW.name: Whirlwind
Q0Iu7pD3RrXPuAvW.description:
You attack in a circle around you, attacking everyone within range.

Range: 1 Space Aura

Make an Area Martial Attack using a Melee Weapon or Unarmed Strike against the AD of every target within range.

  • Hit: The target takes the damage of your Weapon or Unarmed Strike.

Reach Weapon: If you have a Reach Weapon, you can choose to increase the Aura by 1 Space. When you do, you cant Attack targets within 1 Space of you.

Maneuver Enhancements

Damage: (2 SP, Repeatable) The damage increases by 1.

Area: (2 SP, Repeatable) The Aura increases by 1 Space.

Vortex: (2 SP, Repeatable) Each target makes a Might Save. Save Failure: The target is pushed up to 1 Space horizontally in a direction of your choice. The target is moved 1 additional Space each time you use this Enhancement.

system.description: Once per round, you can regain up to half your maximum SP when you perform a Maneuver.

System Tip: Roll this item to trigger Combat Readiness.
